title: Understanding Criteria
text: A criteria is a standard or principle by which something is judged or decided. In the context of data filtering, it refers to the conditions that data must meet to be included in the results.

title: Criteria in Data Filtering
text: When using AutoFilter, criteria are the rules you set to determine which data is displayed. For example, you might set a criteria to show only rows where the value in a certain column is greater than $$10$$.

hintAnswer: a logical rule by which data is tested and chosen
title: Identifying the Correct Definition
text: Which of the following best describes a criteria in the context of data filtering?
choices: the process of filtering activity based on one or more filter criteria
a logical rule by which data is tested and chosen
a method of sorting like ascending and descending, but alphabetical
